But as for these clubs, Dussauts, parades...

He shrugs, dismissive.

‘Who wants to be a card-sharper?’

---

‘Why, have you been a card-sharper then?’

He smirks, recalling the past.

‘How could I help being? Good society, fine times.’ 

---

‘But I did get into prison for debt...’

His eyes darken, remembering.

‘Marfa Petrovna bought me off for thirty thousand.’ 

---

‘If it hadn’t been for that, would you have given her the slip?’

He hesitates, pondering.

‘I don’t know... I was never restless.’

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Svidrigaïlov reflects on his past experiences and relationships, revealing his complex feelings about society and personal freedom.
